articles.author: Alasdair Pal, Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange is due to plead guilty on Wednesday to violating U.S. espionage law, in a deal that will end his imprisonment in Britain and allow him to return home to Australia, ending a 14-year legal odyssey.
articles.title: WikiLeaks' Julian Assange set to be freed after pleading guilty to US espionage charge

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least 24 Palestinians in three separate airstrikes on Gaza City early on Tuesday, health officials said, while tanks deepened their incursion into the town of Rafah in the south of the enclave.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes kill at least 24 in Gaza City, say Gaza officials

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Simon Lewis
articles.description: Two key advisers to Donald Trump have presented him with a plan to end Russia's war in Ukraine -- if he wins the presidential election -- that involves telling Ukraine it will only get more U.S. weapons if it enters into peace talks.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump reviews plan to halt US military aid to Ukraine unless it negotiates peace with Moscow

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich will stand trial for espionage in Russia on Wednesday in a court whose proceedings are classified as a state secret.
articles.title: Behind closed doors, US reporter Gershkovich to go on trial in Russia

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin says Russia's war in Ukraine is part of an existential struggle with the West that demands total focus - but deadly shootings in Dagestan show that militant Islam is a rising threat that may force him to redirect some of his resources.
articles.title: Dagestan shootings spotlight rising Islamist threat for Putin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines is still seeking clarification from the Pentagon about a secret U.S. propaganda operation that aimed to cast doubt among Filipinos about Chinese vaccines at the height of the COVID pandemic, a foreign ministry official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Philippines seeking U.S. clarification on anti-vax propaganda operation

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Dogyun Kim, Daewoung Kim
articles.description: The South Korean government ordered on Tuesday urgent safety inspections at high-risk industrial sites a day after a fire at a lithium battery factory that killed 22 workers with one person still missing.
articles.title: South Korea begins search for answers after battery plant fire kills 22

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants for Sergei Shoigu, the former Russian defence minister, and leading Russian general Valery Gerasimov on Tuesday for alleged crimes committed during Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
articles.title: International Criminal Court issues arrest warrants for Russia's Shoigu and Gerasimov

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iranians choose a president on Friday in a tightly controlled election following Ebrahim Raisi's death in a helicopter crash last month, with the outcome expected to influence the succession to Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran's top decision-maker.
articles.title: Iran’s presidential election dominated by Khamenei loyalists

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: Seventy four years after the Korean War began, North Korean troops are building new fortifications, occasionally inviting warning shots from South Korean counterparts across a border that has been frozen in a state of war.
articles.title: Decades after war, North Korea still builds borders, draws warning shots
